alert.note: Alert for Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:48PM EDT until July 29 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN OWSLEY...NORTHWESTERN PERRY...BREATHITT... SOUTHEASTERN LEE AND SOUTH CENTRAL WOLFE COUNTIES... At 248 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Houston, or 10 miles east of Booneville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Beech around 300 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Altro and Barwick. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
